unnormalised: **Blog Post: My Calendar is a Disaster Zone (aka Indian Festivals)**
normalised: So, my boss asked me to prepone a meeting. Prepone! As if my life is not already a chaotic jalebi. And then he said, "Make sure it does not clash with any major holidays, Rakesh." Rakesh, he says, as if I possess the temporal mastery of a seasoned pandit. Dude, I can barely remember my anniversary, let alone every single festival celebrated in this gloriously, madly diverse country.

normalised: Seriously, it is like trying to navigate the Delhi metro during rush hour, but with more color and sweets. One minute you are wrapping up Diwali on twelfth november two thousand and twenty three (wait, did I buy mithai?), the next you are already gearing up for Christmas on twenty fifth december two thousand and twenty three! How does anyone keep up? My Google Calendar looks like it threw up a rainbow onto a digital grid.

normalised: And do not even get me started on the regional variations! Holi in Mathura is apparently a whole different beast than Holi in Kolkata. I mean, both involve color, but I suspect the Mathura version involves approximately three hundred percent more bhang. I saw a documentary about it once, around three A-M when I could not sleep. Never again.

My cooking skills peak at microwaving Maggi.
